title: Dalio: Why Market Crises Keep Changing the Rules for Investors
description: The first 25 years of this century delivered one upheaval after another: the dot-com crash, the housing collapse, the Great Financial Crisis, unprecedented rounds of quantitative easing, a historic pandemic, an inflation surge, and a retail-trading revolution powered by meme stocks. Romaine Bostick charts how markets absorbed each shock, while Ray Dalio explains the deeper forces that shaped the modern investing landscape. (Source: Bloomberg)
